title: Uint16Array
markdown:
# Uint16Array

The **`Uint16Array`** typed array represents an array of 16-bit unsigned integers in the platform byte order. If control over byte order is needed, use [DataView](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/DataView) instead. The contents are initialized to `0`. Once established, you can reference elements in the array using the object's methods, or using standard array index syntax (that is, using bracket notation).

`Uint16Array` is a subclass of the hidden [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray) class.

## [Constructor](#constructor)

[Uint16Array()](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint16Array/Uint16Array)

Creates a new `Uint16Array` object.

## [Static properties](#static%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits static properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

[Uint16Array.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `2` in the case of `Uint16Array`.

## [Static methods](#static%5Fmethods)

_Inherits static methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Instance properties](#instance%5Fproperties)

_Also inherits instance properties from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

These properties are defined on `Uint16Array.prototype` and shared by all `Uint16Array` instances.

[Uint16Array.prototype.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray/BYTES%5FPER%5FELEMENT)

Returns a number value of the element size. `2` in the case of a `Uint16Array`.

[Uint16Array.prototype.constructor](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Object/constructor)

The constructor function that created the instance object. For `Uint16Array` instances, the initial value is the [Uint16Array](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Uint16Array/Uint16Array) constructor.

## [Instance methods](#instance%5Fmethods)

_Inherits instance methods from its parent [TypedArray](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/TypedArray)_.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Different ways to create a Uint16Array](#different%5Fways%5Fto%5Fcreate%5Fa%5Fuint16array)

```
// From a length
const uint16 = new Uint16Array(2);
uint16[0] = 42;
console.log(uint16[0]); // 42
console.log(uint16.length); // 2
console.log(uint16.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT); // 2

// From an array
const x = new Uint16Array([21, 31]);
console.log(x[1]); // 31

// From another TypedArray
const y = new Uint16Array(x);
console.log(y[0]); // 21

// From an ArrayBuffer
const buffer = new ArrayBuffer(16);
const z = new Uint16Array(buffer, 2, 4);
console.log(z.byteOffset); // 2

// From an iterable
const iterable = (function* () {
  yield* [1, 2, 3];
})();
const uint16FromIterable = new Uint16Array(iterable);
console.log(uint16FromIterable);
// Uint16Array [1, 2, 3]

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                         |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# table-49](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/indexed-collections.html#table-49) |

## [Browser compatibility](#browser%5Fcompatibility)

BCD tables only load in the browser
